sentences.sContent: We had a really tight budget.
...The average budget for a "major" kitchen overhaul in 2006...

...Critics say Congress will give in to lobbyists and let inefficient providers off the hook That is far less likely to happen if Congress also adopts strong "pay-go" rules requiring that any increase in payments to providers be offset by new taxes or budget cuts...
...But US researchers quietly complain about budget restraints and having far fewer icebreakers the Russia...
...Should doctors consider Medicare's budget in deciding what to use...
...I'm not going to do what I think is best for you because I think it's bad for the healthcare budget in Massachusetts...
...With no sign of a new budget to close this gulf...
...because a budget is not just a catalog of programs and taxes...
...Present budget policies tax parents heavily to support the elderly...
...reaching toward the stars seems a dispensable luxury-as if saving one-thousandth of a single year's budget would solve our problems...

phrases.pCn: 避免不必要的开支，节省费用

trans.tranOther: the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent
